section.section: A majority of the full authorized membership of the board of directors of an authority is a quorum to do business.
Unless the bylaws require a larger number, the board may take any action by a majority vote of the directors present at a validly called meeting.

text.section: The board shall determine the times and places of its meetings.

section.section:
A citizen director is entitled to the compensation set by:
The governing body of the single political subdivision that incorporated or continues the authority; or
The governing bodies of the member political subdivisions.
However, the compensation for a citizen director may not be increased or decreased during the term of the director.
A director who is also a member of the governing body of a political subdivision may not receive compensation for service as a director.

text.section:
The board may:
Set the number of officers, agents, and employees that the board considers proper;
Set the powers, duties, and compensation for these employees; and
Elect or appoint any director as an officer, agent, or employee.
